intro: Forstera glabra, commonly known as the smooth forstera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Forstera glabra is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
